Posts.Content: Thank you all for your support. And I think that I am getting a jump start and it is early But I am worried about what comes next.
Posts.Title: worried

Posts.Content: Just had the biopsy completed today and am waiting out come. Can anyone tell what questions to ask? Also guess I am just a punk but the pain meds are starting to wear off and wondering how long before I can start taking my Tramadol? How about a cold pack or heating pad to sit on? Not unbearable but uncomfortable. Will know in a couple of weeks. Thank you all for help and support.
Posts.Title: worried

Posts.Content: Thank you Chuck The pain is not unbearable but more of an hassle. Making me nervous, You know hard to decide what to do, where to sit. Won't be long and it will be bed time so hopefully I can sleep and forget it. Thank you again. I have to give many thanks to my Primary doctor because without her pushing and insisting on the test I would still not have done them.

Posts.Title: worried

Posts.Content: I just got a seconded opinion from a Urologist, they both felt a lump on my prostate. I wanted the seconded opinion because I didn’t want to think about the possibility that I might have cancer. I am 62 years old, have a father that has had PC for 30 years (90 now and doing good) 2 brothers and uncle do not have PC that I know of PSA has gone from 1.1 to 2.7 and now down to 2.4, both doctors said they want to do a biopsy because of lump. I don’t have any urinary problems but do have ED problem. After reading the post on this site I am going to have the biopsy done on Dec 3 and am hoping for good results

Posts.Content: Hi Chuck I also am recently diagnosed with PC. I do not know any of my numbers because doctors office dropped the ball. I am on my way also to get CT and Bone scan today and will pick up my lab work while there. I understand your anxiety. Everyone says keep calm. We all try. Good luck and hope for the best. Greg
